newsitem.title: USA: Sterling Chemicals, BP start up plant.
newsitem.headline: Sterling Chemicals, BP start up plant.

text.p: Sterling Chemicals Inc said the the 150 million gallon per year methanol plant located at its Texas City, Texas, petrochemical facility has started-up and is operating smoothly.
The plant is owned jointly with BP Chemicals Inc and the two company said its production equally, Sterling said.
Construction of the methanol plant began in May 1995.
Sterling said a major portion of the methanol production will be used as a feed stock in its acetic acid unit, which underwent a modernization and expansion project in fiscal 1996.
The remainder of the methanol will be available for both the merchant market and for British Petroleum Co Plc's worldwide acetic acid business.
